Dorothy Morris, 76, was one of six people killed by a gunman in a shooting rampage in Tucson, Ariz. on Jan. 8, 2011 that also left 14 wounded, including the intended target-Representative Gabrielle Giffords, Democrat of Arizona. Ms. Giffords, who was shot in the head, was meeting with constituents outside a supermarket when Jared L. Loughner, a 22-year-old college dropout, allegedly opened fire.
 
 Mrs. Morris was a staunch Republican. But according to her neighbor, she was curious to hear what Ms. Giffords had to say, so she and her husband, George, attended the meet-and-greet on that Saturday morning in January.

 Dorothy Morris - The New York Times
 
 Another casualty of flapping tongues and the right wing media din against our government and our elected representatives.
